column1: The Ring of Thrór was the first of the Seven Rings to be forged
column2: and the last to be recovered by Sauron.

column1: While Sauron himself gave the Dwarves their Rings of Power
column2: this one was originally given to King Durin III of Moria by Celebrimbor
column3: and it remained in his line for thousands of years until it was inherited by Thrór

column1: It was during Thrórs reign that Smaug descended on the Lonely Mountain and drove the Dwarves into exile. Long after his kingdoms destruction
column2: Thrór passed the ring to his son Thráin
column3: who dwelt for many years as an exile from his ancient home.

column2: Thráin set out on an ill-fated quest to regain his kingdom
column3: but he was captured by the spies of Sauron
column4: and the Ring of Thrór was lost forever.

column1: Many Dwarves however did not know the fate of the Ring
column2: and thought that it was lost in Moria when Thrór was killed by Azog. It was thought that one of the reasons Balin wished to Balins Colony was to find the Ring. In the Council of Elrond
column3: Gandalf told Glóin that Balin would not find the Ring there
column4: as it was given to Thráin and lost in Dol Guldur.
